intro: Austrocylindropuntia colubrina, commonly known as the blue paddle cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and it has spiny areoles that bear both flowers and glochids. Austrocylindropuntia colubrina is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its structure and appearance make it a distinctive and visually striking member of the Cactaceae family.
